unnormalised: Okay, so my Uncle Sharma just went through the *absolute* rollercoaster* of trying to update his address on his PAN card. You wouldn’t believe it if I told you. He’s usually so chill, sipping chai and watching cricket, but this… this was next-level stressed Sharma-ji.

unnormalised: It all started because he moved from his old place at 12A, Chandni Chowk, Delhi-6 (yes, the PIN code *is* necessary, trust me, the postman needs all the help he can get) to a swanky new apartment in Gurgaon. He thought, "Ah, easy peasy, just a quick online form." Haha! Famous last words, right?

unnormalised: First hurdle: the website. It looked like it was designed back when Rajiv Gandhi was Prime Minister. Seriously, the font! The colors! My eyes were bleeding just watching him navigate it. Then came the form itself. Turns out, you need, like, 17 different documents to prove you're actually you and that you actually live where you say you live. Who knew updating an address was harder than rocket science?

unnormalised: The best part? He decided to go to a "facilitation center" to get help. Paid some dude Rs. 500 to fill out the form for him. The dude misspelled “Sharma” as “Sarama”. Genius! So now, instead of Uncle Sharma, resident of Planet Earth, we have Mr. Sarama, possibly from another dimension.
